Main dataset labelisation and export method. Take as input an ExportConfig with all parameters, inputs and outputs targets for export, and generate a single, merged dataset with all the Lard metadatas.

src.labeling.labels module

class src.labeling.labels.Labels(path: Optional[Union[str, Path]] = None)[source]

Bases: object

The Label class :

  • defines the different fields of the labels and metadata of the LARD dataset

  • provided utility method to add, export or manipulate them.

The exact metadata is stored in an internal pandas Dataframe, which can be directly accessed for custom usage :

lbl = Labels(csv_metadata_path)
metadata_in_pandas_dataframe = lbl.df
Variables:

  • sep – separator symbol in the export file.

  • default_cols – default metadata columns. Specify all the possible metadata field and their order in the exported field.

Parameters:

path (str or Path) – Path to a Lard metadata csv.

add_label(label_infos: dict)[source]

Add additional labels and metadata, provided as a python dictionary, to the ones stored.

Parameters:

label_infos (dict) – dict with metadata and labels information. Keys should be columns names as described in Labels.default_cols

Returns:

None

Returns:

dict with all the image metadata

reorder_corners() → None[source]

Ensures the names of the corners in the dataset matches their order in the image. The order is the order of corner obtained by reading the image row by row. I.e. the order obtained by sorting the corners on their value (y_corner * image_width + x_corner).

Returns:

None

property watermark_size: str

Return the name of the field of self.df with the watermark sizes of each image

Returns:

Name of the columns which contains the watermark sizes of each image.

Return type:

str

src.labeling.labels_utils module

src.labeling.labels_utils.compute_bbox(corners: array) → array[source]
Returns the smallest rectangle around all the corners of a runway

return [x_min, y_min, x_max, y_max]

Parameters:

corners (np.ndarray) – 2D-array with the corners positions. Expected format is [[x1, y1], [x2,y2], …]

Returns:

1D array with the bbox coordinates in tlbr format.

Return type:

np.ndarray

src.labeling.labels_utils.crop_bbox(bbox: array, width: int, height: int) → array[source]

Crop a box to the dimensions of the image (width, height)

Parameters:

  • bbox (np.ndarray) – bounding box of the runway

  • width (int) – image width

  • height (int) – image height

Returns:

Coordinate of the part of the bbox in the image.

Return type:

np.array

src.labeling.labels_utils.is_runway_image_valid(image_shape: tuple[int], label: DataFrame, debug: bool = False) → bool[source]

Check if a dataset image is valid :

  • it contains exactly one runway visible in it

  • the runway in its entirety is visible in the image

Parameters:

  • image_shape (tuple[int]) – image dimension

  • label (pd.DataFrame) – dataframe with labels

  • debug (bool) – print debug information of why an image was deemed invalid.

Returns:

if the image is valid or not

Return type:

bool
